steamApi.dialogIntro: Enter your Steam Web API Key. This key is stored locally on your machine.
steamApi.getKeyLink: Get your Steam Web API Key
steamApi.helpButton: How to create a Steam Web API Key
steamApi.helpTitle: How to create a Steam Web API Key
steamApi.helpCardTitle: How to Register a Steam Web API Key
steamApi.helpCardBody: This guide provides a step-by-step walkthrough for registering a Steam Web API Key. A Steam Web API Key lets applications securely access specific data from your Steam account, such as game libraries or statistics, when you authorize them to do so.
steamApi.step1Intro: Before you can register a Steam Web API Key, make sure that:
steamApi.step1Bullet1: You have an active Steam account in good standing, secured with Steam Guard (email or mobile authenticator).
steamApi.step1Bullet2: Your account owns at least one purchased game. Brand-new or empty accounts cannot obtain an API key.
steamApi.step1Bullet3: You are using a trusted device and network (never register or view your key on a public or shared computer).
steamApi.step2Intro: Your Steam Web API Key is sensitive information. Anyone who has your key can make API requests on your behalf. Treat it like a password:
steamApi.step2Bullet1: Never share your key with other people, and never post it publicly (for example, on forums or GitHub).
steamApi.step2Bullet2: Only paste your key into tools or websites you fully trust.
steamApi.step2Bullet3: If you suspect your key has been exposed, revoke it immediately and generate a new one.
steamApi.step3Title: 3. Step-by-Step: Registering a Steam Web API Key
steamApi.step3_1Bullet1: Open your web browser and go to https://steamcommunity.com.
steamApi.step3_1Bullet2: Click "Log In" in the top-right corner.
steamApi.step3_1Bullet3: Enter your Steam account name and password.
steamApi.step3_1Bullet4: If prompted, complete Steam Guard verification.
steamApi.step3_2Title: Step 2 - Open the Steam Web API Key page
steamApi.step3_2Bullet1: While logged in, open the Steam Web API Key registration page: https://steamcommunity.com/dev/apikey
steamApi.step3_2Bullet2: The page will display a short description of the Steam Web API and a form titled "Register for a new Steam Web API Key."
steamApi.step3_3Title: Step 3 - Enter a domain name and agree to the terms
steamApi.step3_3Bullet1:
In the "Domain Name" field, enter the domain of the website or service that will use the key.
  • If you do not have a domain, you can enter a placeholder such as localhost, 127.0.0.1, or example.com.
steamApi.step3_3Bullet2: Read the Steam Web API Terms of Use.
steamApi.step3_3Bullet3: Tick the checkbox to confirm that you agree to the terms.
steamApi.step3_3Bullet4: Click the "Register" button to submit the form.
steamApi.step3_4Title: Step 4 - View and copy your new Steam Web API Key
steamApi.step3_4Bullet1: The page reloads and shows your Steam Web API Key near the top.
steamApi.step3_4Bullet2: The key is a long string of letters and numbers (for example: 0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUV).
steamApi.step3_4Bullet3: Select the entire key and copy it (Ctrl+C / Cmd+C).
steamApi.step3_4Bullet4: Store it in a secure location, such as a password manager or an encrypted notes app.
steamApi.step4Title: 4. Basic Example of Using Your Steam Web API Key
steamApi.step4Intro: Once you have a key, you can call Steam Web API endpoints by adding it as a key= parameter to the URL. For example, a simple HTTP request might look like this (replace YOURKEYHERE with your real key):
steamApi.step4Outro: The exact URLs and parameters depend on which Steam Web API interface you are using. Always consult the official documentation for the endpoints you need.
steamApi.step5Title: 5. Revoking or Regenerating Your Steam Web API Key
steamApi.step5Intro: If you no longer need your Steam Web API Key, or you believe it has been compromised, you should revoke it:
steamApi.step5Bullet1: Sign in to your Steam account if you are not already logged in.
steamApi.step5Bullet3: Click the button labeled "Revoke My Steam Web API Key".
steamApi.step5Bullet4: If you need a new key later, return to the same page and register again using the steps above.
steamApi.step6Intro: You may see one of the following issues when trying to register a key:
steamApi.step6Bullet1: Message: "You will be granted access to Steam Web API keys when you have games in your Steam account." In this case, your account does not yet meet the minimum requirements. Purchase at least one game on Steam, wait for the purchase to clear, and try again later.
steamApi.step6Bullet2: Page keeps asking you to sign in - Make sure cookies and JavaScript are enabled in your browser, and that you are logging in with the correct account.
steamApi.step6Bullet3: Security concerns - If any third-party site or person asks for your key and you are unsure why, do not share it. Revoke your key and change your Steam password if you think it has been exposed.
steamApi.footerNote: You now have a registered Steam Web API Key and a basic understanding of how to manage it safely. Keep this page handy as a reference when you need to register, use, or revoke your key.

initialRelease.title: Initial release
initialRelease.description: First public build of Honu's Project Zomboid Hub.

welcome.title: Welcome to Project Zomboid Mod Manager
welcome.body: This quick setup helps you connect your folders, add your Steam Web API key, and start syncing mods.
welcome.bullet2: Add your Steam Web API key for Workshop metadata.
welcome.bullet3: Finish setup and start managing your mods.

tips.title: Quick Tips
tips.bullet1: You can update folders and your Steam API key anytime from the sidebar.
tips.bullet2: Run Sync Local Mod Data before syncing Workshop metadata.
tips.bullet3: Use Mod Filters to narrow the list quickly.

workshopPrompt.title: Fetch Steam Workshop Data
workshopPrompt.body: Do you want to fetch the latest metadata from the Steam Workshop for your mods?

folders.title: Set Required Folders
folders.description: These folders are used to scan your mods and read your Project Zomboid installation details.
folders.userDirNote: Used for exporting server presets and (optional) advanced apply targets.

tooltips.modInfoReadonly: This field is read-only and populated from mod.info.
tooltips.steamReadonly: This field is read-only and populated from the Steam Workshop.
tooltips.modMissing: The following mod could not be found
tooltips.syncToActivate: Sync With Steam Workshop to Activate
tooltips.modFolderUnavailable: Mod folder path is not available.

docs.title: Documentation
docs.intro: Honu's Hub us ajuda a navegar, inspeccionar i gestionar el vostre projecte local Zomboid, amb la integració d'escriptori mitjançant Tauri.

overview.title: Overview
overview.body: The app scans a chosen mods directory, derives metadata from common Project Zomboid mod conventions, and presents everything in a table and summary dashboard.

workflow.title: Workflow
workflow.intro: Follow this end-to-end flow to connect your folders, sync metadata, and generate the Honu Mod Info QoL output.

step1.title: Map folders
step1.body: Open Configure Folders from the sidebar actions and set your Project Zomboid game, workshop, and user directories.

step2.title: Create/enter Steam Workshop key
step2.body: Use Set Steam API Key to paste your key so the app can fetch Workshop metadata.

step3.title: Sync local mod data
step3.body: Run Sync Local Mod Data to scan your Workshop folder and build the local mod list.

step4.title: Sync with Steam Workshop
step4.body: Run Sync With Steam Workshop to pull workshop titles, authors, sizes, and extra metadata.

step5.title: Sync Honu's Mod Info QoL
step5.body: Use Sync Honu's Mod Info QoL to generate/update honus_miqol_db.lua inside your Project Zomboid user folder.
step5.screenshot: Screenshot: Sync Honu's Mod Info QoL

data.title: Data the app uses
data.intro: The app builds a mod listing from information available on disk.
data.bullet1: Mod folder path - resolved absolute path to the mod directory.
data.bullet2: Mod id - extracted from mod metadata when available (commonly from mod.info).
data.bullet3: Name - a display name derived from metadata and/or folder naming.
data.bullet4: Workshop id (optional) - if detected and numeric, the app enables a Steam Workshop link button.
data.bullet5: Status/health indicators - basic signals such as missing or incomplete metadata (where detectable).
data.outro: Not all mods contain complete metadata. When fields are missing, the UI will display best-effort values and may disable actions that require specific data (for example, the Steam link).

features.title: Features
features.bullet1: Mods table - lists detected mods with key fields (name, id, workshop link when available, and path).
features.bullet2: Row details - expand a row to see more information about a mod (when available).
features.bullet3: Open in Steam - opens the Workshop page in your default browser for mods with a valid workshop id.
features.bullet4: Open folder - opens the selected mod folder in your file explorer.
features.mediaPlayer: Media player - play Project Zomboid music tracks from the sidebar. See Media player.
features.logInspectorPrefix: Log inspector - load and filter log files (like console.txt) to quickly find errors and warnings. See
features.bullet6: Dashboard - shows quick stats (for example: total mods detected) and other high-level indicators.

mediaPlayer.title: Media player
mediaPlayer.intro: The sidebar includes a lightweight music player that can scan for Project Zomboid audio tracks (OGG) and play them in-app.
mediaPlayer.bullet1: Playlist - shows detected tracks and basic metadata (title/artist/album when available).
mediaPlayer.bullet3: Seek + volume - scrub through the track and adjust volume/mute.

server.title: Gestió de servidors
server.intro: Utilitza la pàgina Servidors per gestionar els fitxers locals del servidor de Project Zomboid.
server.bullet1: Crea un servidor nou per generar els fitxers predeterminats .ini, _SandboxVars.lua, _spawnpoints.lua i _spawnregions.lua.
server.bullet2: Copia un servidor existent per duplicar-ne els fitxers amb un nom nou.
server.bullet3: Edita les variables INI i Sandbox i actualitza spawnpoints/spawnregions directament a l'app.

logInspector.title: Log inspector
logInspector.intro: The log inspector helps you open and filter log files (for example, console.txt) to troubleshoot crashes, mod load problems, and server startup issues.
logInspector.bullet1: Select a file - browse to any .txt or .log file, or use a default path when available.
logInspector.bullet2: Filter - choose log levels (ERROR/WARN/LOG/DEBUG/TRACE), set a date/time window, and limit the maximum number of entries displayed.
logInspector.bullet3: Search - filter entries by text across the parsed message and the raw source line.
logInspector.bullet4: Live polling - optionally refresh on a timer to watch logs update while the game/server is running.
logInspector.bullet5: Clear - truncate the selected log file (use with care).

folderSetup.title: Folder setup
folderSetup.step1: Open the Mods page from the left sidebar (under HOME).
folderSetup.step2: Use Browse Mods Folder in the ACTIONS menu to select your Project Zomboid mods directory (commonly projectzomboid/mods).
folderSetup.step3: After selection, the app scans the directory and populates the mods table and dashboard.
folderSetup.tip: Tip: If you switch machines or move your mods directory, simply browse again to update the stored path.

tauri.title: Desktop (Tauri) integration
tauri.bullet1: Filesystem access - directory browsing and scanning is performed via the desktop shell.
tauri.bullet2: Open external links - Steam Workshop links open using your OS default browser.
tauri.bullet3: Open folders - launches the OS file explorer focused on the mod directory.

privacy.title: Privacy & storage
privacy.bullet1: Local data - the selected mods folder path and scan results may be cached locally to improve UX.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.bullet1: No mods appear after scanning - verify the selected folder is your actual Project Zomboid mods directory and that it contains mod subfolders.
troubleshooting.bullet2: Steam links are disabled - ensure the mod has a valid numeric workshop id (not all mods are Workshop-based).
troubleshooting.bullet3: Open folder does nothing - confirm the Tauri backend is running and that OS permissions allow opening the file explorer.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.q1: Does the app edit my mods?
faq.a1: No. The core workflow is read-only: it scans folders and displays metadata. Actions such as opening folders or Workshop links do not modify mod files.
faq.q2: Why is some information missing for a mod?
faq.a2: Mods vary in how consistently they include metadata. If fields like id or workshop id are missing, the app will show what it can and disable features that rely on those fields.
